intro: Aethionema trinervium, commonly known as the three-veined rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing, perennial herb that typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and have three distinct veins, giving it its scientific name. Aethionema trinervium is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salty air and harsh environmental conditions.
